entry.title: Null Signature
entry.summary:
Author: AiKotoba

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 132,256Chapters: 11/?Kudos: 104

Summary: Dick Grayson has seen monsters before. He just never expected to recognize one. The pit is Gotham’s best-kept secret—an underground arena where bio-engineered beasts fight to the death, and the crowds cheer louder for blood than justice. But it’s not the monsters that pull him in. It’s the man behind one of them. Red Hood doesn’t speak much. Doesn’t take off the helmet. Doesn’t miss. He baits the deadliest creature in the ring like it’s an extension of himself—and maybe it is. Dick was only supposed to observe. Now he can’t look away. Because Wrathnir fights like someone who’s trained. Red Hood watches like someone who’s remembering. And Dick’s starting to think the thing in the cage isn’t the only ghost down here.

entry.title: too busy being yours to fall for someone new
entry.summary:
Author: auguststarchaser

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 17,634Chapters: 3/5Kudos: 141

Summary: “Don’t want to be alone,” Dick admits, eyes dropping to the ground in shame. “I’m sorry.” And while Jason had been able to resist his seducing words a few times, he’d never really managed Dick’s vulnerable ones. The two of them stand in silence for a moment, just waiting for the other to make a move. Jason’s hesitant, afraid to open the can of works he’d so desperately tried to hold back. “That doesn’t mean you come here, Dick,” Jason says finally. “Fuck, we talked about this already.” “Just wanted to go home.”   Or where Dick and Jason have never been good at letting each other go.

entry.title: Glass Rain
entry.summary:
Author: soaring_bubblegum

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 124,665Chapters: 25/42Kudos: 1,007

Summary: Jason Todd wakes up in the wrong Gotham.Here, he stayed dead. Here, his death broke his family so completely they became the monsters they once fought. Dick Grayson haunts the skyline with wings and talons, Barbara Gordon moves like a spider made of shadow, and something that might have once been Batman rules from a corrupted cave.The city is quarantined, the air tastes of ozone and old blood, and Jason should be running.Instead, he finds himself drawn to the creature that was once his brother—the one stalking him through twisted streets with eyes that still burn with something almost human.Some hunts, it turns out, go both ways.

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 2,536Chapters: 1/2Kudos: 84

Summary: “Rumour down in Crime Alley is that you’re the dumb blonde of the Bat Clan. Got nothing but a nice face and a few cool flips to offer the crowd.” Jason reached a hand up and tapped at his temple. “Got nothing up there in that pretty, little head of yours.” Nightwing actually laughed at that, sounding unbelievably tired, and more than ready to just pass out where he sat. Which would be a very annoying thing for Jason to have to deal with this early in the morning.  It was supposed to be his one off day this month dammit. “So they say, yeah,” Nightwing agreed, voice so soft that Jason only heard it because of his enhanced hearing. There was a beat of silence, followed by a warning of incoming stupidity in the form of a teasing smile curving Nightwing’s lips. “You think my head is pretty, Jay?”   Or, Jason Todd has a rather...peculiar first encounter with Bludhaven's darling hero, Nightwing.
